summary: In this context, ethylbenzene and 4-xylene are both components of a BTEX (Benzene, Toluene, Ethylbenzene, and Xylenes) mixture used for analytical purposes. They are mentioned as part of a stock standard mixture prepared for sampling and analysis, indicating their relevance in the study of volatile organic compounds. However, there is no detailed discussion of their specific interactions or relationships beyond their inclusion in the same mixture.
